item.title: Hedge on Corner of Lydia and Aperfield Road Opposite 39 - 45 Lydia Road, 20th June
item.description:
This hedge is over 6ft tall and extends at least 3 ft over the pavement. That is 3 ft from the property boundary. It's obscures drivers view of oncoming traffic and makes it dangerous to cross the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lydia Road, Slade Green, London

item.title: The Litter Bin, Council owned has not been emptied for more than a week and is overflowing onto the Sir Jofhn Morden pathway between Kidbrooke Grove and Kidbrooke Park Road., 20th June
item.description:
The Litter Bin is full and overflowing so that waste is scattered on the pathway. I have removed some of the excess waste myself, but people keep dropping waste by the bin as there is nowhere else to safely dispose of it nearby.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Kidbrooke Grove, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: POTHOLE HAS GOT BIGGER o/s 174 THERE WILL BE ACCIDENT, 20th June
item.description:
Resident reporting please could someone urgently look into this pothole that has grown in size o/s No 174 this is a danger to all vehicles all pedestrians crossing all children on bikes. This pothole was done last year but now has all collapsed again. This is going to cause serious damage and accidents. Resident is saying she is a ex enforcement officer for Bexley and will take this further
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 172, Rowley Avenue, Blendon, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet
